title: Drawing, "Two projects for an altar mensa"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Horizontal rectangle. Above is a variation of 1938-88-1365, with a different design of the ledge and of the tabernacle. Below is the scale. Below: the left half is shown. The top is supported by a pilaster strip with a cherub as a capital and by two lateral volutes. The sarcophagus is angular and has on top a cross above palm branches. Colored background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Two projects for an altar mensa".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2626.
